name: North Park Transportation
subhead: Independent LTL company in the Rocky Mountain region
description: North Park Transportation requested a full site rebuild to coincide with a re-brand. North Park provided a large amount of new content with a flexible vision for the site. The site would replace their exsiting site, while maintaining their existing scheduling and quote system. In under two months I worked directly with the company leaders to launch a brand new site. Nopk.com is built with NextJS, Tailwind, HTML, with a Netlify CMS

name: Display Ads Hub
description: Progressive's marketing department is responsible for a large number of display ads, released continuously throughout the year. With a comprehensive cross departmental review process, and an extensive backlog of content, I developed an internal site to store and present ads both while in development and after they ship to vendors. The site allows our clients to view all the requested sizes animated simultaneously, as well as reference material and project links. The site is written with NuxtJs, SASS,and HTML, and hosted and released through Azure Dev Ops.

name: Inclusity
description: I initially was contracted by Inclusity to make a series of accessibility updates. Since then, we have expanded the scope of the contract to a site redesign. With a large amount of pages, content, and a limited budget, we partnered to update the site on an extended time table. Design updates are made periodically to slowly shift towards the newly established brand guildlines, while the wordpress back office is maximized for organizational effectiveness. I developed a system of page templates that utilize the existing color scheme to give a consistent and professional feel throughout the site while adding sprinkles of color.

name: Life@Progressive
subhead: Progressive's blog about working with the company
description: Life@Progressive is an ongoing blog written by Progressive employs detailing their experiences getting and working at Progressive. The blog updates quarterly adding 12-15 new articles, while updating exsiting articles, and making periodic enhancements to the UI and design. Life@Progressive is part of the greater Progressive.com codebase written in C#/Razor.

name: Progressive Animated Display Ads
subhead: Animated internet ads to market Progressive Insurance
description: Progressive's marketing department is responsible for a large number of display ads, released continuously throughout the year. Display ads are released as part of larger marketing campaigns, delivered in a variety of sizes, and are required to be extremely small in file size. Because of the limited file size, animated ads are written essentially to replicate gifs or videos - which would be too large to meet the strict guidelines. These ads present a unique and fun challenge in writing minimal code that work on 99% of devices used worldwide. Display ads are written in Javascript, CSS, and HTML.

name: Display Ads Hub CLI
subhead: A Custom NodeJS CLI to Support Progressive's internal Display Ads Hub
description: Progressive's marketing department is responsible for a large number of display ads, released continuously throughout the year. With many years of display ads stored on our servers, and very specific delivery formats required, I created a NodeJs CLI to create all the necessary folders and files needed for each new display ad. The CLI walks the user through the process of creating a new ad, as well as archiving, editing, and removing existing ads all by updating a corresponding database.

name: Progressive's Corporate Responsibility
subhead: Progressive's dedicated page outlining their dedication to improving social and environmental outcomes
description: Progressive's corporate responsibility page updates yearly adding, updating, and removing pages and content. The desigin is consistently updated to match the brand standards of Progressive.com and Progressive's larger properties. As with Life@Progressive, the Corporate Responsibility page and subpages are part of the greater Progressive.com codebase written in C#/Razor.
